text:
Hi guys,
I have a client who is showing an event overview. I created a react app to show the overview but everything else is just HubSpot pages / modules. I put the events in HubDB. I have a column with capacity and a column with registrations to check the capacity for the events. My client wants a form for people to register to these events. Is there any way to update the column in HubDB when someone sends the form? It would be great if there is some workflow setup available to achieve this.
I do not have the budget to create a simple script on a server to update the HubDB column using the HubDB API and Form API.
hi guys, i have a stupid question... In the HubSpot academy i see this side bar and view...
i dont see that in my sandbox version and cant find it
Anybody else running into CSS caching issues... Made some changes to a site last Friday but still seeing the cached CSS which is making the nav appear broken.
<https://www.topsoe.com/products/catalysts?hs_preview> forces the newest version but it won't stick and the general public is still seeing the broken version of a lot of pages

I am trying to add an inline_rich_text module to my HTML template. Adding the hubl code from the references `{% inline_rich_text "inline_rich_text" field="my_text_field" html="<p>My rich text default content</p>" %}`  shows the module being locked on the page editor view.  What am I missing?
Hi, anyone use OneTrust as there cookie consent solution on their HubSpot site? I'm new to HubSpot and need help understanding how I can interact with HubSpot cookies.
You will see that while in the page editor.   <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-pages-editor/create-and-edit-pages-in-HubSpot#edit-an-existing-page>

By cookie consent, do you mean the typical ...
'By clicking on “Allow” or continuing to browse any content on this site, you consent to our use of cookies.'

?

If so, HubSpot has a built in tool to create and set those

Settings > Cookies
Hi guys is there a channel for SFDC sync? we experience changes(mostly good one:-)) we would love to be informed about rather than fixing the outcome.
